January 11, 2016

NCE Task Groups Open for New Members

Sign your chapter up for the NCE Gold Membership pass! With this level of membership, all your chapter staff and volunteers will have access to The Arc’s comprehensive professional development program, NCE of The Arc Chapter Leadership Program. This program consists of in-person training and networking opportunities, online webinars and discussion forums that serve the needs of your management and program staff. NCE members also have the opportunity to attend Summer Leadership Institute and NCE Pre-Convention at reduced rates. Sign up today!

OK THEN

NCE tasks groups are responsible for ensuring NCE continues to grow and provide opportunities for exchanging ideas, professional development training, and support and mentoring for successful leadership. Task groups are a great way to connect with fellow chapter staff and help strengthen The Arc. The task groups are:

  • Program Planning: support program design and execution of SLI and Pre-Convention, including session topics and speakers.
  • Membership Recruitment: recruit chapters and get more staff involved in professional development activities.
  • Membership Engagement: identify activities to encourage NCE members to take advantage all that NCE offers, including The Arc Connection portal, SIGs, the Standards for Excellence program and SLI and Pre-Convention.
  • Silent Auction @ Pre-Convention: solicit auction donations and ensure the event goes smoothly.
  • SLI and Pre-Convention Scholarship: solicit applications from peers to attend SLI and Pre-Convention and select recipients.
  • NCE Awards @ National Convention: solicit submissions, select awardees, and ensure a successful function.

    If you are interesting in joining, sign up here. Learn about the valuable benefits that NCE offers by visiting our NCE pages

Pregnancy Outcomes for Women with I/DD

Wednesday, January 21



Did you know women with I/DD had longer hospital stays, and were more likely to have Caesarean deliveries in contrast to other women? Rates of adverse pregnancy outcomes were elevated for women with I/DD across a range of measures, including early labor, preterm birth, and preeclampsia, and their infants were more likely to have low birth weight. Dr. Susan Parish will present findings from a study that compared deliveries among women with I/DD to the general obstetric population, and discuss the implications of these findings, as well as the targeted interventions needed to address these detrimental outcomes. Register here.

This project is funded through Rehabilitation Research and Training Center on Developmental Disabilities and Health (RRTCDD), United States Department of Health and Human Services, Administration for Community Living (ACL), National Institute on Disability, Independent Living, and Rehabilitation Research (NIDILRR), Grant # 90RT5020-01-00.

3:00pm—4:00pm Eastern Time
2:00pm—3:00pm Central Time

1:00pm—2:00pm Mountain Time
12:00pm—1:00pm Pacific Time

The Arc Connection

As we are thinking about the holidays and reflecting up on the work that we do, it is important that we don’t forget the reasons why we are driven to serve people with I/DD.  Please take some time to view this video, Putting People First: Key Concepts in Serving People with I/DD, to get a refresher on concepts that will help you improve the ways we support and serve these amazing individuals who impact our lives every day.

SIG Spotlight

Are any of your chapters seeking advice on Education and Early Intervention? The Education and Early Intervention Special Interests Group covers topics such as Special Needs Pre-School requirements for all three-and-four year olds, special education laws, parents' rights and responsibilities. Sign in or sign up for this and other special interest groups here.

Resources & Opportunities

With social media being a critical element of today's communications with the public and engaging millennials, your chapter may have greater reach by implementing a social media policy that addresses your needs and outlines goals for using social media. The Standards for Excellence guidelines Administrative Policies has sample policies that helps you promote news and activities and set employee rules for engaging in social media.
